reviews.review_msg: Overall a very good prof. He is very concerned about clarity, which is great. If he doesn't think something is clear in his notes, he will reword it and send the updated version to students. His notes are good and he has lots of office hours. In lectures he makes it clear what is important. There's a lot to know, but that's the course for ya.
First midterm was fair, class average was high. Second midterm was a bit on the tricky side, but it was still fair. Overall a great prof :)

Professor is tough but fair I would say. He won't give special consideration to people (basically because people usually don't deserve it, and it would be unfair anyways). Text book use is very low, so just study what he gives you in the notes. Exams can be a bit tough if you don't study well. He kind of reminds me a bit of george carlin.

Awesome prof. Lectures are boring, but that is the only negative I can think of. His notes are extremely clear on what you have to know and what he'll test you on. Exams are very fair. Go to his office hours & you'll realize that he's one of the most knowledgeable profs who can give you tons of helpful tips and info. Highly Recommended!

His 1st time teaching this course, he originally teaches Bisc333. His exams are somewhat fair, though written parts are rather general and less detailed, 2nd mt avg was 10% lower than the first one. Lectures are good with decent notes in powerpoints. And a funny guy. Textbook will help u understand the material better, not to mention problem sets.

One of the easiest professors I've encountered. Her lectures help clear any questions you may have but heavily based on textbook. Read the text and study by it, and you'll ace the exams. As simple as that.

Lynne is a fabulous prof who has a deep interest in her subject of teaching. ASK QUESTIONS when you are confused and you'll get them answered efficiently and without attitude. She is nice to students and cares how we do. The textbook was essential - EVERY ANSWER was in the textbook. So read ahead and ask questions and you'll do JUUUUST fine.

Great prof. Extremely nice and very clear. Sure her notes are mostly diagrams but that's why you're supposed to read the textbook. Material was interesting. Way better course than MBB 222. Only qualm with Quarmby is that my final mark was 85.5/100 and I ended up with only a B+. How does that happen?
The BEST Prof I have had!!! Very helpful and very nice with her students
